definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: Jump out of a plane while still sewing your parachute and you'll get a good sense of pace in this business.
sentences.chinese: 或者說當你還在縫補降落傘的時候就跳出飛機。

sentences.english: I need a needle and some thread to mend this shirt with.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一根針和一些線縫補這件襯衫。

sentences.english: They help the residents with their laundry and mending.
sentences.chinese: 他們幫助居民縫補和洗衣裳。

sentences.english: My mother mended the clothes for me.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽給我縫補了衣服。

sentences.english: Badly torn garments should be mended by an experienced seamstress.
sentences.chinese: 破得厲害的衣服應當找有經驗的女縫工縫補。

sentences.english: I expect this has got sewing things in it .
sentences.chinese: 我希望縫補工具都裝在這裏邊。

sentences.english: Jane has sewn up a hole in a sock.
sentences.chinese: 簡把襪子上的洞縫補好了。

sentences.english: I hung my own shelves and paid the dry cleaner to hem my pants.
sentences.chinese: 我自己收拾衣架子，並支付乾洗店爲我縫補褲子。

sentences.english: He washed and mended Minna's little dresses and mended her doll.
sentences.chinese: 比爾也清洗和縫補明娜的小衣服，縫補她的玩具。

sentences.english: He washed and mended Minna's little dresses and mended her doll.
sentences.chinese: 比爾也清洗和縫補明娜的小衣服，縫補她的玩具。

sentences.english: Turn out to have been no more than sticking-plaster solutions to fundamental cracks in the traditional career model.
sentences.chinese: 不過是對傳統職業生涯模式根本缺陷的縫縫補補而已。

sentences.english: He baked, and cooked, and sewed, and planed, and cobbled boots.
sentences.chinese: 他會烤麪包，煮食物，縫補，刨木板，上靴底。

sentences.english: She nodded , sighed , and went on stitching .
sentences.chinese: 她點了點頭，嘆了口氣又繼續縫補衣眼。

sentences.english: Each sewing has to meet a spining pain…
sentences.chinese: 每一次的縫補也會遭遇針刺的疼痛。

sentences.english: All uniform alterations are to be made by the hotel seamstress only.
sentences.chinese: 所有制服的縫補及改動須由酒店的縫補員工進行。

definition: lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心
lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
